channel.title: StepZen Blog Template
channel.description: A blog built with Next.js, Tailwind.css and StepZen.

item.title: Learn To Love Your Jamstack BFF
item.description: Let's explore the BFF pattern, how it applies to Jamstack applications and how to make it easier to implement.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Exploring JavaScript Client Libraries for GraphQL
item.description: Exploring three popular GraphQL JavaScript client libraries that you can use to connect to a GraphQL API in the browser or in Node.js.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Thinking in Jamstack
item.description: One of the more challenging aspects of Jamstack development can be that it requires you to change your mental model around when to render content in a web app.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: GraphQL and the Jamstack
item.description: A look at the intertwined evolution of the Jamstack and GraphQL and how popular Jamstack tools are built upon a GraphQL foundation.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What Is the Jamstack in 2021?
item.description: What Jamstack means is evolving. While labels don't help you get your work done, they are also important.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Consuming GraphQL in Plain JavaScript
item.description: A GraphQL query is just a standard HTTP request, no special libraries needed. Let's look at how to create one in JavaScript and Node.js.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: How to Write GraphQL Queries
item.description: GraphQL queries are what allow GraphQL to be efficient in how it gets data, by allowing you to express only what you need but also exactly everything you need. In this post, we'll see how.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: The Best Kept Secret for Free Developer Education
item.description: CFE.dev has live virtual meetups and hundreds of hours of free sessions for developers on a wide range of topics.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Getting Started with Next.js for Jamstack Development
item.description: Next.js is an increasingly popular solution for creating Jamstack sites using JavaScript and React. In this post we explore how to build your first Jamstack site using Next.js that connects to a headless CMS for content using the Sourcebit open source project.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: 4 New Tools to Watch in the Jamstack Ecosystem
item.description: There have been a lot of new innovations in the Jamstack ecosystem already in 2020. Let's look at some of the major highlights including new static site generators and new deployment tools.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What is Markdown and Why Does it Matter to the Jamstack?
item.description: Markdown is so ubiquitous in the Jamstack that many people confuse the M in the JAM acronym to mean Markdown rather than markup. But how did this happen and why does Markdown play such a big role in Jamstack development?
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Advanced Hugo Template Tips and Tricks
item.description: Hugo's Go-powered templates can accomplish some very powerful templating tasks. In this post, I share some tips and tricks that I've found useful when building advanced Hugo templates.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Building Documentation Sites with the JAMstack
item.description: Documentation sites are a longstanding and common use case for the JAMstack. In this post we explore some of the options available to you for developing them and show an example of how to build one.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: How to Choose Your Static Site Generator
item.description: The static site generator (SSG) is a key ingredient in developing a JAMstack web app, but there are literally hundreds to choose from. I offer my advice and guidance on choosing the option that's best for you.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Build Your First Sourcebit Plugin
item.description: Sourcebit is a fully-extensible open source project that can connect any data source with a JAMstack site. In this post, we'll learn how you can build a plugin to connect to a data source, target SSG or transform data.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Getting Started with Ecommerce and the JAMstack
item.description: A look at some of the options for building an ecommerce site using the JAMstack including a demo that shows how to easily build am ecommerce site using a headless CMS and Snipcart.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Tips for Running Virtual Meetups and Events
item.description: Tips and advice from 2.5 years of experiences running online meetups, workshops and events.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Data-driven JAMstack with Sourcebit
item.description: Sourcebit is a new open source project that aims to make it easy for developers to connect their JAMstack site to data coming from a broad range of sources. In this tutorial, we explore how to use it.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: The J in JAMstack Does Not Stand for React (or Angular, Vue, Svelte, etc.)
item.description: Correcting what seems to be a common misconceptions about what makes an app JAMstack
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: 3 Strategies for Migrating from Wordpress to JAMstack
item.description: Migrating from Wordpress to JAMstack offers a number of potential benefits, but it can be difficult to know what the best strategy for transitioning content is. This post offers some potential strategies for making the move.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Is JAMstack All Branding and Little Substance?
item.description: JAMstack has been accused of being just fancy buzzword branding, but is there actual substance behind the term? I share my thoughts on why I think there is.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Baby Steps with Next.js for JAMstack
item.description: Sharing my learning process as a React and Next.js noob
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Build Your Own API with Netlify Functions and Zapier Webhooks, Part 2
item.description: See how to use Zapier webhook and Netlify Functions to dynamically update content on your site and rebuild it.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Build Your Own JAMstack API with Netlify Functions and Zapier Webhooks, Part 1
item.description: Connecting your JAMstack site to a Zapier webhook using Netlify functions gives you access to all sorts of cool features.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What to Expect from the JAMstack in 2020 - Ahmad Awais
item.description: Ahmad Awais of Cloudinary shares what changes we saw in the JAMstack ecosystem in 2019 and what he expects for 2020.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What to Expect from the JAMstack in 2020 - Bud Parr
item.description: What exciting new things happened in 2019 in JAMstack? What can you expect to see in 2020? Bud Parr, creator of The New Dynamic community and newsletter, shares his thoughts.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Thoughts on the State of JS Survey
item.description: A look at some of the results from the latest JavaScript developer survey and some items that stood out.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What to Expect from the JAMstack in 2020 - Chris Coyier
item.description: Chris Coyier shares what she thought was important about this past year in JAMstack and what she thinks you can expect for the year to come.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What to Expect from the JAMstack in 2020 - Tara Manicsic
item.description: Tara Manicsic shares what she thought was important about this past year in JAMstack and what she thinks you can expect for the year to come.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What to Expect from the JAMstack in 2020 - Bryan Robinson
item.description: Bryan Robinson shares what he thought was important about this past year in JAMstack and what he thinks you can expect for the year to come.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What to Expect from the JAMstack in 2020 - Gift Egwuenu
item.description: Gift Egwenu shares what she thought was important about this past year in JAMstack and what she thinks you can expect for the year to come.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What to Expect from the JAMstack in 2020 - Raymond Camden
item.description: Raymond Camden shares what he thought was important about this past year in JAMstack and what he thinks you can expect for the year to come.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Creating a JAMstack Site with Open Authoring Using Netlify CMS
item.description: Leverage the power of the community by creating a JAMstack site that anyone can edit and contribute using NetlifyCMS's open authoring.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: 15 JAMstack Resources You Need as a Web Developer
item.description: Whether you are getting started or already advanced, these are the links that you'll need as a JAMstack developer.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Gating Content in JAMstack Sites
item.description: A step-by-step guide to adding registration and login requirements to sections of content on a JAMstack site.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Easy Monitoring of Your Netlify Builds
item.description: A new tool let's you automatically detect and monitor your Netlify builds from your own site.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Own Your Content, Broaden Your Audience
item.description: Dev.to gives developers access to a wide audience while letting them keep ownership of their content. The integration with Stackbit makes this even easier.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: The Evolution of Web Content Management
item.description: A look at the evolution of web content management from the early days of the web to the headless, cloud-based CMS systems of today.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What's Wrong with the Tech Interview Process?
item.description: There is widespread belief that the tech interview process is broken but little in the way of movement to change it.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Markdown is Markup and Other Confusions Around JAMStack
item.description: What makes a site JAMStack? A lot of it is in the M for markup.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Understanding OAuth Authorization Flows
item.description: What happens when you authenticate in an application using OAuth 2.0 implicit and PKCE flows.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Don't Let Your Tools Define You as a Developer
item.description: Developers are defining themselves into ever smaller niches and that concerns me.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Getting Started with Offline Data in Web Apps Pt. 3
item.description: A guide to getting started with IndexedDB for storing large amounts of complex data offline.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: So You Want to Run a Developer Conference
item.description: Some tips and advice based on my experiences running conferences for more than a decade.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Knowing the Web's History is Critical to Its Present and Future
item.description: Understanding the history of the web will help guide you to the its future.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: How to Write a Great Conference Talk Proposal from Conference Organizers
item.description: Advice and resources from the organizers of some major conferences on how to create a compelling conference talk proposal.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: The Best Newsletters to Subscribe to for a Frontend Developer
item.description: A summary of newsletter resources related to frontend development, JavaScript, CSS and more.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Technical Debt is Not Just Technical
item.description: Many factors can influence technical debt and many of them have nothing to do with code.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Getting Started with Offline Data in Web Apps Pt. 2
item.description: Exploring what localStorage is, how it works and how it can be used to store and access data offline.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Choosing What to Learn
item.description: How do you decide what's important to focus on? I share some of my own ideas and want to know yours.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Getting Started with Offline Data in Web Apps Pt. 1
item.description: A look at different options for determining the user's online/offline status and connection speed.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Confused by JavaScript's const? Me too!
item.description: Constants in JavaScript don't necessarily behave the way you think they would.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Using Netlify to the Fullest
item.description: Finally taking advantage of some of the Netlify platform's more advanced features.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Should I Build It?
item.description: A brief look at the ethical dilemmas facing today's developers.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: A Developer Career Doesn't Have to Be Linear
item.description: Some tips based on my experience for finding your unique path in your career development as a developer.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: 3 Tips for Writing Great Tech Posts
item.description: Some broad guidelines for writing technical or code-focused blog posts and articles.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Quick Tips and Tricks for Hugo Development
item.description: A look at some simple but overlooked as well as some advanced techniques for the Hugo static site generator.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Building and Deploying a JAMStack site with Stackbit
item.description: A quick introduction to using the Stackbit service for creating a content-managed JAMStack site
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: A Fresh Look at Netlify CMS (Part 2)
item.description: Configuring an existing JAMStack site to use Netlify CMS
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Promoting Perceived Performance with Prefetching
item.description: A look at two libraries designed to help improve the perceived performance of web apps
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: There's More Than One Way to Become a Developer
item.description: An overview of the pros and cons of the different education options to become a developer
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Some Things You May Have Missed in the Stack Overflow Developer Survey (2019 Edition)
item.description: A quick look at some highlights from the latest edition of StackOverflow's survey
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: A Fresh Look at Netlify CMS (Part 1)
item.description: Getting started with Netlify CMS on project using a fresh install.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Want to Speak at Conferences? I'll Help Review Your CFP Submissions
item.description: Need some help with your session abstract for a conference call for papers? I'm here to assist.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Allies Don't Make Inclusion About Themselves
item.description: I will never play baseball. Sure, I played as a kid, briefly, and I was terrible. I have since tried...
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: 14 of My Favorite Developer Blog Posts in 2018
item.description: In 2018, we focused on performance, mobile and how tough it can be to be (or become) a dev.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Get Your Code Ready for the Holidays!
item.description: Some holiday-themed links for developers.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Is Today the Best Time to be a Developer? No...but We're Getting Better.
item.description: While working as a developer certainly has its rewards, there are some major issues we need to address.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: JavaScript Standardization - An Interview with Jory Burson
item.description: Talking JavaScript language standards and TC39 with Jory Burson of Bocoup
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: 4 Things Developers Take for Granted That Used to Be Really Hard
item.description: While development is still complicated, some things have definitely improved.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What I Learned from a Year of Running Free Developer Events
item.description: Running developer events - even online only ones - can be tough but rewarding, exhausting but also thrilling.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What Developers Should Know from Microsoft Build
item.description: We're clearly entering a new era for Microsoft and for developers that moves from tools and platforms to cloud and services.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: GitHub Pages Now Support HTTPS - Use It!
item.description: GitHub finally announces HTTPS support for sites hosted using their GitHub Pages service.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Running SSL on localhost
item.description: Some strategies for local testing with SSL
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Some Things You May Have Missed in the Stack Overflow Developer Survey
item.description: Let's dig into the data a little bit.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: There's No Such Thing as a Full Stack Developer
item.description: A rant about defining titles with unachievable standards.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Conforming to JavaScript Code Styles
item.description: Tips on for adhering to style guides by integrating Prettier with ESlint in VS Code.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: A License to Confuse
item.description: More evidence that developers aren't noticing the licenses in the software they use.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What are the Must Follow Resources for Developers?
item.description: A comprehensive list with descriptions of the sites and newsletters for developers that I follow.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Why Web App Performance Matters and What to Watch Out For - An Interview with Tammy Everts
item.description: Tammy Everts talks about what performance metrics matter most to developers.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: From Ice Skating to Bootcamp to Full Stack Dev - An Interview with Aimee Knight
item.description: Aimee Knight shares some of what she's learned on her journey from ice skater to full stack developer
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: From Cordova to Bots to Serverless - An Interview with Brian Leroux
item.description: Brian Leroux previews his upcoming presentation by discussing why he created arc.codes and why serverless matters.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: That Topic Has Already Been Covered!
item.description: Don't let the fact that a topic has already been written about dissuade you from adding your own voice.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: Developers Need to Start Paying Attention to Licenses
item.description: Ignoring software licenses can be dangerous. Let's try to understand them - open source, commercial and more.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)

item.title: What the Web Owes Flash
item.description: As we conduct our post-mortems on Flash, it's important to remember that Flash helped make the web what it is today.
item.author: brian.rinaldi@gmail.com (Brian Rinaldi)
